pullRequest.body:
We add a lemma that says that composing on the left by a uniformly continuous function on the codomain preserves uniform convergence.


---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

Please use `{s : Set Î²} {F : Î¹ â†’ Î³ â†’ Î²} {f : Î³ â†’ Î²}` and assume `âˆ€ i x, F i x âˆˆ s` and `âˆ€ x, f x âˆˆ s`.
Sorry, I'm being a bit stupid, is there an easy way to prove it using this formulation? The old proof breaks, and I'm struggling to get it to work.

I think the reason this is true is that `Subtype.val : â†¥s â†’ Î²` is a `UniformEmbedding`. Here's a proof (which could be cleaned up a bit if we had any lemmas relating `UniformEmbedding` and `TendstoUniformly`, but we don't), but it doesn't work right here because this file doesn't know about `UniformEmbedding` :sad:, which makes sense.
```lean
import Mathlib

open Topology Uniformity Filter Set

universe u v w x

variable {Î± : Type u} {Î² : Type v} {Î³ : Type w} {Î¹ : Type x} [UniformSpace Î²] [UniformSpace Î³] {F : Î¹ â†’ Î± â†’ Î²} {f : Î± â†’ Î²} {s s' : Set Î±}
  {x : Î±} {p : Filter Î¹} {p' : Filter Î±} {g : Î¹ â†’ Î±}

/-- Composing on the left by a uniformly continuous on the codomain function preserves uniform
  convergence -/
theorem UniformContinuousOn.comp_tendstoUniformly' (s : Set Î²) (F : Î¹ â†’ Î± â†’ Î²) (f : Î± â†’ Î²)
    (hF : âˆ€ i x, F i x âˆˆ s) (hf : âˆ€ x, f x âˆˆ s)
    {g : Î² â†’ Î³} (hg : UniformContinuousOn g s) (h : TendstoUniformly F f p) :
    TendstoUniformly (fun i => fun x =>  g  (F i x)) (fun x => g (f x)) p := by
  rw [uniformContinuousOn_iff_restrict] at hg
  lift F to Î¹ â†’ Î± â†’ s using hF with F' hF'
  lift f to Î± â†’ s using hf with f' hf'
  rw [tendstoUniformly_iff_tendsto] at h
  have : Tendsto (fun q : Î¹ Ã— Î± â†¦ (f' q.2, (F' q.1 q.2))) (p Ã—Ë¢ âŠ¤) (ð“¤ s) :=
    h.of_tendsto_comp uniformEmbedding_subtype_val.comap_uniformity.le
  apply (UniformContinuous.comp_tendstoUniformly hg ?_)
  rw [â† tendstoUniformly_iff_tendsto] at this
```
Also, it's not clear to me why you are restricting to `g : Î² â†’ Î²`, so I changed the type signature to better match other things in this file, so `f : Î± â†’ Î²` and `g : Î² â†’ Î³`.
Ok nice, this proof works in the `UniformConvergenceTopology` file so I put it there. I don't think I meant to restrict `g` like that, but I agree this is better, thanks!
It seems like at least `F`, `f`, `s`, `s'`, and `x` are unused. Please check the others too

```suggestion
    TendstoUniformly (fun i x => g (F i x)) (fun x => g (f x)) p := by
```
Looks like you can drop the parentheses
It should be enough to assume `hF` only eventually along `p`.
Ok I added an eventually version, which I proved making use of the one we had, but I think its probably worth having both.
We already have `eqOn_comm`.
I thought it was strange we didnt have it! but loogle came back with no results. I've removed it now.

```suggestion
lemma tendstoUniformly_congr {F F' : Î¹ â†’ Î± â†’ Î²} {f : Î± â†’ Î²} (hF : F =á¶ [p] F') :
```
Please revert this change.

```suggestion
/-- Composing on the left by a uniformly continuous function on the codomain preserves uniform
```

```suggestion
  rw [eventually_iff_exists_mem] at hF
```
(assuming it works)
Do you need the explicit universes or will `Type*` do?

```suggestion
  exact âŸ¨fun h => h.congr (by aesop), fun h => h.congr (by simp_rw [eqOn_comm]; aesop)âŸ©
```

```suggestion
variable {Î± Î² Î³ Î¹ : Type*} [UniformSpace Î²] [UniformSpace Î³] {p : Filter Î¹}
```
It seems less than 100 char

Please merge master
```suggestion
    h.of_tendsto_comp isUniformEmbedding_subtype_val.comap_uniformity.le
```
